description: A course for students beginning to study and acquire skills in Modern Standard Arabic, in oral and written communication. Emphasis is on the spoken language in a conversational setting. The alphabet, basic reading and writing will be introduced.
title: Introduction to Arabic 1
notes: [Note: SI 101R is not open to students with native, near-native or similar advanced ability.]
subject: SI

description: This course builds on SI 101R, focusing on the vocabularies and grammatical conventions of everyday and professional interactions, oral and written.
title: Introduction to Arabic 2
notes: [Note: SI 102R is not open to students with native, near-native or similar advanced ability.]
subject: SI

description: An introduction to the caliphates, cities, and cultures of Islam, through film and selected texts, including the experience of Islam in Canada as revealed through its writers. This course provides a foundation for Studies in Islam, establishing a context for multidisciplinary approaches to a wide variety of topics.
title: Islam in the World
subject: SI

description: This course continues the work begun in first-year courses in Modern Standard Arabic, preparing for information conversation within cultural contexts. The grammar of sentence structure and word order is stressed.
title: Intermediate Arabic 1
notes: [Note: SI 201R is not open to students with native, near native, or similar advanced ability.]
subject: SI

description: This course builds beyond the grammar of sentence structure and word order in Modern Standard Arabic into paragraph construction, as well as formal and informal conversational situations and conventions.
title: Intermediate Arabic 2
notes: [Note: SI 202R is not open to students with native, near native, or similar advanced ability.]
subject: SI

description: This course examines conceptions of East-West divide and confrontation as well as topics of interest, both geo-political and religious, that influence the relationships of Muslims and the Western world. The focus is on the history of Muslims in the West and the challenges of integration of Muslim communities in pluralistic, secular societies.
title: Islam, the West, and the Modern World
subject: SI

description: This course continues to develop reading, writing, and speaking skills in Modern Standard Arabic, using such materials as short academic articles, video clips, and newspaper articles, with emphasis on vocabulary building and comprehension.
title: Advanced Arabic 1
notes: [Note: SI 301R is not open to students with native, near native, or similar advanced ability.]
subject: SI

description: In this course, students will develop higher reading, writing, and discussion skills in Modern Standard Arabic in varied contexts such as social conversation, informal discussion, and business interview.
title: Advanced Arabic 2
notes: [Note: SI 302R is not open to students with native, near native, or similar advanced ability.]
subject: SI

description: This course examines the lives and contributions of Muslim women in history - past and present - and political, social, and cultural influences that have affected the lives of Muslim women around the world. Challenging stereotypes of Muslim women, and using religious, historical, and literary images, the course focuses on contributions of Muslim women as religious leaders, scholars, and politicians.
title: Islam, Women, and the Modern World
subject: SI

description: This course allows for in-depth study of selected topics in interdisciplinary studies in Islam.
title: Special Topics in Islam
notes: [Note: This course is repeatable up to three times, subject to different content.]
subject: SI

description: This course brings together the diverse strands that constitute the student's learning and experience in required as well as elective courses of Studies in Islam. Exploring Islam in a variety of contexts, the approach is interdisciplinary and integrative.
title: Understanding Islam
notes: [Note: In addition to the three prerequisite courses, a student must have completed at least four Studies in Islam elective courses.]
subject: SI
